name: Kanibus WAN-Compatible Eye-Tracking System
description: Advanced eye-tracking and facial analysis system with T2I-Adapters (94% more efficient than ControlNet) and WAN 2.1/2.2 compatibility
dockerfile:
FROM pytorch/pytorch:2.1.2-cuda12.1-cudnn8-devel

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /workspace

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    wget \
    curl \
    unzip \
    build-essential \
    libgl1-mesa-glx \
    libglib2.0-0 \
    libsm6 \
    libxext6 \
    libxrender-dev \
    libgomp1 \
    ffmpeg \
    libfontconfig1 \
    libfreetype6 \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Upgrade pip and install base packages
RUN pip install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel

# Install ComfyUI
RUN git clone https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI.git /workspace/ComfyUI
WORKDIR /workspace/ComfyUI
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt

# Clone Kanibus nodes
RUN cd custom_nodes && git clone https://github.com/your-repo/kanibus.git Kanibus

# Install Kanibus dependencies
WORKDIR /workspace/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/Kanibus
COPY requirements_cloud.txt .
RUN pip install -r requirements_cloud.txt

# Copy cloud installation script
COPY install_cloud.py .

# Run cloud installation
RUN python install_cloud.py --cloud=runpod --auto-install

# Create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p /workspace/ComfyUI/models/t2i_adapter \
             /workspace/ComfyUI/models/controlnet \
             /workspace/ComfyUI/output \
             /workspace/ComfyUI/temp \
             /workspace/logs

# Set permissions
RUN chmod -R 755 /workspace

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8188

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:8188/ || exit 1

# Default command
CMD ["python", "/workspace/ComfyUI/main.py", "--listen", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8188"]
startup_script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${BLUE}=== KANIBUS RUNPOD STARTUP ===${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸš€ Starting Kanibus WAN-Compatible Eye-Tracking System${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸ“Š T2I-Adapters: 94% more efficient than legacy ControlNet${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸŽ¯ WAN 2.1/2.2 Compatible${NC}"

# Navigate to workspace
cd /workspace

# Update system packages
echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ“¦ Updating system packages...${NC}"
apt-get update > /dev/null 2>&1

# Install system dependencies if not already installed
if ! command -v git &> /dev/null; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ”§ Installing system dependencies...${NC}"
    apt-get install -y git wget curl unzip build-essential \
        libgl1-mesa-glx libglib2.0-0 libsm6 libxext6 \
        libxrender-dev libgomp1 ffmpeg libfontconfig1 \
        libfreetype6 > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Clone ComfyUI if not exists
if [ ! -d "/workspace/ComfyUI" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ“¥ Cloning ComfyUI...${NC}"
    git clone https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI.git
    cd ComfyUI
    pip install -r requirements.txt > /dev/null 2>&1
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… ComfyUI already exists${NC}"
    cd ComfyUI
fi

# Clone Kanibus if not exists
if [ ! -d "/workspace/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/Kanibus" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ“¥ Cloning Kanibus nodes...${NC}"
    cd custom_nodes
    git clone https://github.com/your-repo/kanibus.git Kanibus
    cd Kanibus
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Kanibus already exists${NC}"
    cd custom_nodes/Kanibus
    git pull origin main > /dev/null 2>&1 || echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Could not update Kanibus${NC}"
fi

# Install Kanibus dependencies
echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ“¦ Installing Kanibus dependencies...${NC}"
if [ -f "requirements_cloud.txt" ]; then
    pip install -r requirements_cloud.txt > /dev/null 2>&1
else
    pip install -r requirements.txt > /dev/null 2>&1
fi

# Run cloud installation script
echo -e "${YELLOW}âš™ï¸  Running cloud installation script...${NC}"
if [ -f "install_cloud.py" ]; then
    python install_cloud.py --cloud=runpod --auto-install
else
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ install_cloud.py not found, using fallback installation${NC}"
    python download_models.py --force 2>/dev/null || echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Model download may be needed${NC}"
fi

# GPU Information
echo -e "${BLUE}ðŸŽ® GPU Information:${NC}"
python -c "import torch; print(f'CUDA Available: {torch.cuda.is_available()}'); print(f'GPU Count: {torch.cuda.device_count()}'); [print(f'GPU {i}: {torch.cuda.get_device_name(i)}') for i in range(torch.cuda.device_count())]" 2>/dev/null || echo -e "${RED}âŒ Could not detect GPU${NC}"

# System Information
echo -e "${BLUE}ðŸ’» System Information:${NC}"
echo "CPU Cores: $(nproc)"
echo "RAM: $(free -h | awk '/^Mem:/ { print $2 }')"
echo "Disk Space: $(df -h /workspace | awk 'NR==2 { print $4 " available" }')"

# Create necessary directories
mkdir -p /workspace/ComfyUI/models/t2i_adapter \
         /workspace/ComfyUI/models/controlnet \
         /workspace/ComfyUI/output \
         /workspace/ComfyUI/temp \
         /workspace/logs

# Set proper permissions
chmod -R 755 /workspace

# Test installation
echo -e "${YELLOW}ðŸ§ª Testing installation...${NC}"
cd /workspace/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/Kanibus
python -c "from src.gpu_optimizer import GPUOptimizer; opt = GPUOptimizer(); print('âœ… GPU Optimizer working')" 2>/dev/null || echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  GPU optimizer test failed${NC}"

# Start ComfyUI
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸš€ Starting ComfyUI with Kanibus...${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}ðŸŒ Access ComfyUI at: http://localhost:8188${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}ðŸ“š Kanibus Documentation: https://github.com/your-repo/kanibus${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸŽ¯ T2I-Adapters loaded (94% more efficient)${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}ðŸ”§ WAN 2.1/2.2 compatibility enabled${NC}"

cd /workspace/ComfyUI

# Apply GPU optimizations before starting
if [ -f "custom_nodes/Kanibus/src/gpu_optimizer.py" ]; then
    python -c "from custom_nodes.Kanibus.src.gpu_optimizer import GPUOptimizer; opt = GPUOptimizer(); opt.apply_optimizations()" 2>/dev/null || echo -e "${YELLOW}âš ï¸  Could not apply GPU optimizations${NC}"
fi

# Start ComfyUI
exec python main.py --listen 0.0.0.0 --port 8188
